When trying to print an extra new line with IO.println s!"Hello ", the turns into Â¬ regardless of whether I hit Space, Tab, or move the cursor around. I could get the to stay by typing \n, but is there a better workaround? Ideally I would disable this specific keybinding in favor of just using ot for negation.

I also tried disabling Lean 4 > Input: Eager Replacement Enabled' in settings per https://github.com/leanprover/vscode-lean4/blob/master/vscode-lean4/manual/manual.md#unicode-input, but it doesn't seem to work as space and left/right still create the Unicode.
I never thought that \\ was a workaround, I simply thought that this is how you type \!
Ah that makes sense, so then the intended usage is not to mix \ with non-Unicode characters but to first escape the \. Or change the prefix character altogether if that's a hassle

I am pretty sure I've seen @Mario Carneiro saying he's minor-annoyed by this as well in some thread awhile back. Perhaps another workaround is to redefine \n (and \t) to be an abbreviation for itself in your config and to move not and to somewhere else.

I was able to find the relevant setting to disable \n altogether while keeping \not:

"lean4.input.customTranslations": {
    "n": ""
}
Sam Burnham has marked this topic as resolved.
